</image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;e9330e88.1502">   <title>Conference Announcement </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;e9330e88.1502</link>   <description> Revealing the Past, Securing the Future<br>25-27 March 2015<br>All Souls Bolton<br><br>The Churches Conservation Trust\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds conference will explore the interdependence of heritage sites and communities.<br>Revealing the Past, Securing the Future will bring together sector specialists and professionals to share learning on how high quality design and expert conservation can reimagine traditional buildings, enliven communities and secure the future of heritage sites.<br>The topic we will explore is: How do organisations and communities together find, nurture and develop sustainable, long-term community uses for our finest historic buildings?<br>You\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdll hear first-hand from experts from the Heritage Alliance, the Heritage Lottery [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-02T13:45:50+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Susan van Schalkwyk</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;e9330e88.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;a25268e1.1410">   <title>Re: When is a building not vernacular? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;a25268e1.1410</link>   <description> Hello all BISI people,<br>Just a quick email to mention the publication of a new book on the Archaeology of Buildings:<br><br>[cid:image002.jpg@01CFED37.5C95F770]<br><br>http://www.bloomsbury.com/uk/building-colonialism-9781472519269/<br><br>Shameless plug, I know, but there\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds no point writing these things if no-one reads \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdem.<br>Please feel free to drop me a line if you want more details.<br>Thanks,<br>Daniel<br><br>Dr Daniel Rhodes<br>Area Archaeologist<br>National Trust for Scotland, Hermiston Quay, 5 Cultins Road, Edinburgh, EH11 4DF<br>Tel: 0844 493 2421, Mobile: 077 1378 6252 [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-21T14:00:24+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Daniel Rhodes</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;a25268e1.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;38624363.1409">   <title>Re: new very interesting book of houseplans in the Netherlands </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;38624363.1409</link>   <description> Dear all,<br>I am glad to tell you that my recent article about tile stove and the spread of &quot;stube&quot; just has been published:<br>Rainer Atzbach, The house, the tile stove and the climate change. Some thoughts on building archaeological evidence for climate change between Medieval Warm Period and Little Ice Age, Zeitschrift f\ufffd\ufffdr Arch\ufffd\ufffdologie des Mittelalters 41, 2013 (2014), 241-254.<br>Please feel free to download a digital off-print here:<br>https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/33947869/Atzbach_ZAM_final.pdf<br>Best wishes<br>Rainer   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-25T08:41:34+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rainer Atzbach</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;38624363.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;a6c1da2b.1409">   <title>new very interesting book of houseplans in the Netherlands </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;a6c1da2b.1409</link>   <description> New Housebook from the Dutch Rijksdienst voor het Cultureel Erfgoed.<br><br>Huisplattegronden in Nederland. Archeologische sporen van het huis.<br>House Plans in the Netherlands Archaeological traces of the house.<br><br>This book traces the development of housing construction in the Netherlands, from the arrival of the first farmers 7,000 years ago until the thirteenth century. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-25T09:15:49+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>carlo jengember</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;a6c1da2b.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;c156fad8.1409">   <title>When is a building not vernacular? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;c156fad8.1409</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;c156fad8.1409">When is a building not vernacular? </a></description>   <dc:date>2014-09-05T16:53:24+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mark Gardiner</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;c156fad8.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;26f9fb84.1407">   <title>BISI Photo Gallery </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;26f9fb84.1407</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>Pictures from the BISI 2014 conference are now available to view at http://www.qub.ac.uk/sites/BISI/PhotoGallery/<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Liz   </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-26T13:45:42+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Liz Thomas</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;26f9fb84.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;178fbdcb.1407">   <title>Buildings in Society International mailing list </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;178fbdcb.1407</link>   <description> Welcome to the Buildings in Society International mailing list.   </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-16T13:20:45+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jill Campbell</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISI;178fbdcb.1407</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
